intro: Thuranthos revolutus, commonly known as the spiral leaf fern, is a striking tropical plant characterized by its unique, curling fronds. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is native to the humid forests of Southeast Asia. The plant features long, slender stems with spirally arranged leaves that give it its distinctive appearance. Its fronds are typically dark green and have a leathery texture, which helps it retain moisture in its natural habitat. Thuranthos revolutus is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its aesthetic appeal and air-purifying qualities.
